comments.comment: "The reason they say that the earth is flat in the Bible is because they thought it was! The people at the time all thought the earth was flat all of them..."  # Eratosthenes of Alexandria (d. 194 BC) is credited with being the first person in history to measure the Earth's circumference. Ancient Greeks since the time of Eratosthenes already knew the Earth was NOT flat.   "Of course if the earth stopped that would cause problems but God can stop those problems..."  # Really? How do you know that?  Here's my favorite passage from the bible: "Judges 1:19 The LORD was with the men of Judah. They took possession of the hill country, but they were unable to drive the people from the plains, because they had chariots fitted with iron." So, if the "omnipotent" god can not overcome "chariots of iron", what makes you think he can stop those problems?
